Interface_name: TCP Server - side by using socket in python
Instruction:
Task Description: Implement a simple HTTP server using TCP sockets in Python that can handle basic GET and HEAD requests, send appropriate responses, and stream data to connected clients.

Class Description: HTTPServer is a TCP-based HTTP server implementation that handles incoming client connections, processes HTTP requests, and manages data streaming to clients.

Attributes:
- socket: [socket.socket] - The TCP socket object used for server operations
- conn: [socket.socket] - The active client connection socket
- host: [str] - The server's host address (None if bound to all interfaces)
- port: [int] - The server's listening port
- bound: [bool] - Flag indicating whether the server is bound to an address

Methods:
- bind(host="127.0.0.1", port=0) -> None - Binds the server to the specified host and port. If port is 0, uses an available port. Sets up listening socket.
- open(timeout=30) -> HTTPRequest - Accepts an incoming connection, processes the HTTP request, and returns the parsed request object. Times out after specified seconds.
- write(data) -> None - Sends data to the connected client. Raises IOError if no active connection.
- close(client_only=False) -> None - Closes the client connection and optionally the server socket. If client_only is True, keeps server socket open.

Helper Class Description: HTTPRequest is used to parse incoming HTTP requests from raw request text.

Attributes:
- rfile: [BytesIO] - Buffer containing the request data
- raw_requestline: [bytes] - The first line of the HTTP request
- error_code: [int] - Error code if request parsing failed
- error_message: [str] - Error message if request parsing failed
- command: [str] - The HTTP method (e.g., "GET", "HEAD") from parsed request

Methods:
- parse_request() -> None - Parses the HTTP request (inherited from BaseHTTPRequestHandler)
- send_error(code, message) -> None - Stores error information when request parsing fails
